title: Steiner-Hardness: A Query Hardness Measure for Graph-Based ANN Indexes
abstract: This paper introduces Steiner-Hardness, a novel query hardness measure for graph-based approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) indexes. Our approach provides theoretical insights into query difficulty and enables better index design and optimization strategies.

title: DumpyOS: A Data-Adaptive Multi-ary Index for Scalable Data Series Similarity Search
abstract: DumpyOS presents a data-adaptive multi-ary index structure for scalable data series similarity search. The approach dynamically adapts to data characteristics and provides efficient similarity search capabilities for large-scale time series collections.

title: DCIVET: Exploring Compact Index for Variable-Length Subsequence Matching on Time Series
abstract: DCIVET introduces a compact index structure for efficient variable-length subsequence matching on time series data. The approach addresses the challenge of handling subsequences of different lengths while maintaining query efficiency.

title: Akane: Perplexity-Guided Time Series Data Cleaning
venue: Proceedings of the ACM on Management of Data
abstract: Akane presents a novel approach to time series data cleaning using perplexity-guided techniques. The method effectively identifies and corrects anomalies and errors in time series data, improving data quality for downstream analysis.

title: High-precision Online Log Parsing with Large Language Models
abstract: This paper presents a high-precision approach for online log parsing using large language models. The method achieves superior accuracy in real-time log analysis, enabling better system monitoring and debugging capabilities.

title: Enhancing Adaptive Deep Networks for Image Classification via Uncertainty-aware Decision Fusion
abstract: This work enhances adaptive deep networks for image classification through uncertainty-aware decision fusion. The approach improves classification accuracy by intelligently combining predictions from multiple network branches based on uncertainty estimates.

title: AS-Parser: Log Parsing Based on Adaptive Segmentation
abstract: AS-Parser introduces an adaptive segmentation approach for log parsing that automatically adjusts to different log formats and structures. The method achieves high accuracy across diverse log types without manual template definition.

title: Self-Adaptive Scale Handling for Forecasting Time Series with Scale Heterogeneity
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of forecasting time series with scale heterogeneity through self-adaptive scale handling techniques. The approach automatically adjusts to different scales within the same time series, improving forecasting accuracy.

title: Static and Streaming Discovery of Maximal Linear Representation Between Time Series
abstract: This paper presents algorithms for discovering maximal linear representations between time series in both static and streaming scenarios. The approach enables efficient identification of linear relationships in large-scale time series data.

title: Towards a Generic Framework for Mechanism-guided Deep Learning for Manufacturing Applications
abstract: This work proposes a generic framework for mechanism-guided deep learning in manufacturing applications. The approach integrates domain knowledge with deep learning models to improve performance and interpretability in industrial scenarios.

title: A Novel Multi-dimensional Time-series Data Anomaly Detection Model Based on Generative Adversarial Network Aided Autoencoder
abstract: This paper presents a novel anomaly detection model for multi-dimensional time-series data using generative adversarial networks aided autoencoders. The approach effectively identifies anomalies in complex multi-variate time series.

title: Graph-and Tree-based Indexes for High-dimensional Vector Similarity Search: Analyses, Comparisons, and Future Directions
abstract: This survey paper provides comprehensive analyses and comparisons of graph-based and tree-based indexes for high-dimensional vector similarity search, offering insights into future research directions in this important area.

title: Dumpy: A Compact and Adaptive Index for Large Data Series Collections
abstract: Dumpy presents a compact and adaptive index structure for large data series collections. The approach achieves excellent performance in both storage efficiency and query processing for massive time series datasets.

title: Constructing Compact Time Series Index for Efficient Window Query Processing
abstract: This paper presents a compact time series index structure designed for efficient window query processing. The approach significantly reduces storage overhead while maintaining high query performance for range and window queries.

title: NLC: Search Correlated Window Pairs on Long Time Series
abstract: NLC introduces an efficient method for searching correlated window pairs on long time series. The approach enables discovery of temporal correlations across different time periods in large-scale time series data.

title: Efficient Consensus Motif Discovery of All Lengths in Multiple Time Series
abstract: This paper presents an efficient algorithm for discovering consensus motifs of all lengths in multiple time series. The approach enables comprehensive pattern discovery across different time series with varying motif lengths.

title: An Interpretable Time Series Classification Approach Based on Feature Clustering
abstract: This work proposes an interpretable time series classification approach based on feature clustering. The method provides both high classification accuracy and interpretable insights into the classification decisions.

title: Online Summarizing Alerts through Semantic and Behavior Information
abstract: This paper presents an online approach for summarizing alerts using both semantic and behavior information. The method enables efficient alert management in large-scale systems by providing meaningful alert summaries.

title: ML-Parser: An Efficient and Accurate Online Log Parser
venue: Journal of Computer Science and Technology
abstract: ML-Parser presents an efficient and accurate approach for online log parsing using machine learning techniques. The method achieves high parsing accuracy while maintaining real-time processing capabilities.

title: GRAB: Finding Time Series Natural Structures via A Novel Graph-Based Scheme
abstract: GRAB introduces a novel graph-based scheme for finding natural structures in time series data. The approach effectively identifies meaningful patterns and structures in complex time series through graph-based analysis.

title: Apache IoTDB: time-series database for internet of things
abstract: Apache IoTDB is an open-source time-series database designed specifically for Internet of Things applications. This paper presents the system architecture, storage engine, and query processing capabilities of IoTDB.

title: ELIS++: A Shapelet Learning Approach for Accurate and Efficient Time Series Classification
abstract: ELIS++ presents an enhanced shapelet learning approach for time series classification that achieves both high accuracy and efficiency. The method improves upon traditional shapelet-based classification techniques.

title: PLQ: An Efficient Approach to Process Pattern based Log Query
venue: Journal of Computer Science and Technology
abstract: PLQ introduces an efficient approach for processing pattern-based log queries. The method enables fast and accurate retrieval of log entries matching complex patterns in large-scale log datasets.

title: Log Pattern Mining for Distributed System Maintenance
abstract: This paper presents log pattern mining techniques for distributed system maintenance. The approach automatically discovers meaningful patterns in system logs to support maintenance and troubleshooting activities.

title: KV-match: A Subsequence Matching Approach Supporting Normalization and Time Warping
abstract: KV-match presents a novel subsequence matching approach that supports both normalization and time warping for more flexible and accurate matching. The method achieves significant improvements in both accuracy and efficiency.

title: MVS-match: An Efficient Subsequence Matching Approach Based on the Series Synopsis
abstract: MVS-match introduces an efficient subsequence matching approach based on series synopsis. The method provides fast and accurate subsequence matching capabilities for large-scale time series data.

title: Efficient Learning Interpretable Shapelets for Accurate Time Series Classification
abstract: This paper presents an efficient approach for learning interpretable shapelets for accurate time series classification. The method combines high classification accuracy with interpretability of the learned patterns.

title: Finding Maximal Significant Linear Representation between Long Time Series
abstract: This paper addresses the problem of finding maximal significant linear representations between long time series. The approach enables discovery of meaningful linear relationships in large-scale temporal data.

title: Similarity Join on Time Series by Utilizing a Dynamic Segmentation Index
abstract: This paper presents a similarity join approach for time series using dynamic segmentation index. The method enables efficient similarity joins on large time series datasets through adaptive segmentation strategies.

title: A Distributed Multi-level Composite Index for KNN Processing on Long Time Series
abstract: This paper presents a distributed multi-level composite index for efficient k-nearest neighbor processing on long time series. The approach enables scalable similarity search in distributed environments.

title: Clustering Time Series Utilizing a Dimension Hierarchical Decomposition Approach
abstract: This paper presents a time series clustering approach utilizing dimension hierarchical decomposition. The method effectively handles high-dimensional time series clustering through hierarchical dimension reduction.

title: An Efficient K-means Clustering Algorithm On MapReduce
abstract: This paper presents an efficient K-means clustering algorithm implemented on MapReduce framework. The approach enables scalable clustering for large datasets in distributed computing environments.

title: Topical Presentation of Search Results on Database
abstract: This paper presents a topical presentation approach for search results on databases. The method organizes search results by topics to improve user experience and information discovery.

title: A Data-adaptive and Dynamic Segmentation Index for Whole Matching on Time Series
abstract: This paper presents a data-adaptive and dynamic segmentation index for whole matching on time series. The approach adapts to data characteristics and provides efficient whole sequence matching capabilities.

title: Finding semantics in time series
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of finding semantics in time series data. The approach enables automatic discovery of meaningful semantic patterns and structures in temporal data.

title: An algorithmic approach to event summarization
abstract: This paper presents an algorithmic approach to event summarization. The method automatically generates concise and informative summaries of events from large-scale data streams.

title: Efficient Episode Mining with Minimal and Non-overlapping Occurrences
abstract: This paper presents an efficient approach for episode mining with minimal and non-overlapping occurrences. The method discovers frequent episodes in sequential data while avoiding redundant patterns.

title: A Low Granularity Classifier for Data Streams with Concept Drifts and Biased Class Distribution
venue: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering
abstract: This paper presents a low granularity classifier for data streams with concept drifts and biased class distribution. The approach effectively handles evolving data streams with imbalanced class distributions.

title: LOCI: Load Shedding through Class-Preserving Data Acquisition
abstract: LOCI presents a load shedding approach through class-preserving data acquisition. The method maintains classification accuracy while reducing computational load in data stream processing.

title: On Reducing Classifier Granularity in Mining Concept-Drifting Data Streams
abstract: This paper addresses the problem of reducing classifier granularity in mining concept-drifting data streams. The approach improves classification efficiency while maintaining accuracy in evolving data environments.
